<<<<<<< HEAD
By the King. A proclamation. Charles R. Whereas it is found by experience, that traffique with infidels and barbarous nations not in amity with us, ... England and Wales. Sovereign (1660-1685 : Charles II) Charles II, King of England, 1630-1685.
2 sheets (versos blank)
Printed by the assigns of John Bill and Christopher Barker, printers to the Kings most excellent Majesty, London : 1674.
Title from caption title and first lines of text. At end of text: Given at our court at Whitehall, the thirtieth day of November, in the six and twentieth year of our reign. Concerns steps being taken to preserve the rights to trade granted in letters patent to the Royal African Company 27 September 1672. Steele notation: Arms 87 Us, vice 2) do Company,. Two copies filmed consecutively at UMI Tracts Supplement reel C18; these copies consist of one contiguous sheet. Reproduction of original in the British Library.
=======

2 sheets (versos blank)
Printed by the assigns of John Bill and Christopher Barker, printers to the Kings most excellent Majesty, London : 1674.
Title from caption title and first lines of text. At end of text: Given at our court at Whitehall, the thirtieth day of November, in the six and twentieth year of our reign. Concerns steps being taken to preserve the rights to trade granted in letters patent to the Royal African Company 27 September 1672. Steele notation: Arms 87 Us, vice 2) do Company,.
